goals.question: What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration over time
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is an increasing or decreasing trend of CO2 concentration over time.

goals.question: What is the average CO2 concentration for each year?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average CO2 concentration for each year
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the year with the highest and lowest average CO2 concentration.

goals.question: What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify the range of CO2 concentration values and if there are any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between CO2 concentration and temperature?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of CO2 concentration and temperature
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is a correlation between CO2 concentration and temperature.

goals.question: What is the seasonal variation of CO2 concentration?
goals.visualization: Line chart of CO2 concentration over time with seasonal decomposition
goals.rationale: This visualization helps to identify if there is a seasonal pattern in CO2 concentration and if it varies across years.

code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data = data.dropna(subset=['date'])
    data = data.sort_values(by='date')
    plt.plot(data['date'], data['co2_concentration'])
    plt.title('What is the trend of CO2 concentration over time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    data['Year'] = data['Year'].dt.year
    data = data.groupby('Year').mean().reset_index()
    plt.bar(data['Year'], data['CO2 concentration (ppm)'])
    plt.axhline(y=data['CO2 concentration (ppm)'].max(), color='r', linestyle='--', label=f"Max: {data['CO2 concentration (ppm)'].max():.2f}")
    plt.axhline(y=data['CO2 concentration (ppm)'].min(), color='g', linestyle='--', label=f"Min: {data['CO2 concentration (ppm)'].min():.2f}")
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the average CO2 concentration for each year?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['CO2 concentration'].plot(kind='hist', bins=20, color='green', alpha=0.5)
    plt.axvline(data['CO2 concentration'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean')
    plt.axvline(data['CO2 concentration'].median(), color='blue', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Median')
    plt.legend()
    plt.title('What is the distribution of CO2 concentration?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    plt.scatter(data['CO2 concentration'], data['Temperature'])
    plt.title('What is the relationship between CO2 concentration and temperature?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    data.set_index('date', inplace=True)
    decomposition = seasonal_decompose(data['co2'], model='additive', period=12)
    fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(12, 6))
    ax.plot(data.index, data['co2'], label='CO2 Concentration')
    ax.plot(decomposition.trend.index, decomposition.trend, label='Trend')
    ax.plot(decomposition.seasonal.index, decomposition.seasonal, label='Seasonal')
    ax.plot(decomposition.resid.index, decomposition.resid, label='Residual')
    ax.legend(loc='best')
    plt.title('What is the seasonal variation of CO2 concentration?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
